title: Employer Nomination Scheme visa (subclasses 121 and 856)
summary: This page provides information about the Employer Nomination Scheme visa (subclasses 121 and 856), which closed to new applications on 1 July 2012. It describes who can still be added to an existing application, what the visa allows, associated costs, and the obligations of visa holders and employers.

application_status.notes: Applicants could lodge only on or before 30 June 2012. You can still add a partner or dependent child if the application has not yet been decided.

structured_data.description: The Employer Nomination Scheme allowed Australian employers to sponsor foreign nationals for a permanent visa to work in Australia. The visa is for applicants who were in Australia and lodged a visa application on or before 30 June 2012.
what_the_visa_allows: become eligible for Australian citizenship (if meeting requirements)
sponsor eligible family members for permanent residence
travel to and from Australia for five years from the date the visa is granted (after that, a resident return visa or other visa is needed)

visa_holders_information.rights_and_obligations_summary: Explains the rights and obligations of visa holders.
visa_holders_information.vevo_availability: Visa holders can use Visa Entitlement Verification Online (VEVO) for free to check visa details and entitlements.

employer_obligations: comply with all relevant Australian standards
comply with workplace legislation for wages and working conditions

notify_changes_requirements.notes: Failure to provide new passport details may cause significant delays at the airport and possible denial of boarding.
